  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Instantiates the GameView, adds keystroke and focus listeners, and starts the game. Also makes sure the high scores are saved in case the window closes mid-game.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set. Applications may create other stages, if needed, but they will not be primary stages.
      See Also:
      • GameView

    • onLostFocus

      public void onLostFocus()
      Called when the window loses focus. Stops the game and tells the GameView (gameView) to handle losing focus (by updating the status message).
      See Also:
      • GameView.onLostFocus()

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Tells the GameModel (gameModel) to restart the game, then tells the GameView (gameView) to update itself.

    • showDebugConsole

      public void showDebugConsole()
      Shows the debug console in a new window. In order for the debug console to be linked to the current game, the GameModel (gameModel) is passed as an argument to the DebugConsoleController

    • repaintView

      public void repaintView()
      Tells the GameView (gameView) to update itself

    • updateStatus

      public void updateStatus(String string, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Tells the GameView (gameView) to update the status message
      Parameters:
      string - The message to be displayed
      color - The color of the string to be displayed

    • saveScores

      public void saveScores()
      Tells the GameModel (gameModel) to save scores. Used in the pause menu when exiting.
      See Also:
      • PauseMenuController.exitToMainMenu(ActionEvent)

    • displayNewHighScore

      public void displayNewHighScore(int newHighScore)
      Tells the Tells the GameView (gameView) to update because there is a new high score.
      Parameters:
      newHighScore - The new high score
